com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.interfaces.shared_services

Interface IBasicSearchService<O>


  • public interface IBasicSearchService<O>
    Provides very basic Lucene-type search services - querying, filtering, and faceting
    Author:
    acp

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CompletableFuture<Long> count(Optional<String> query_string, Optional<String> filter_string)
      Count the number of objects matching a simple lucene-type query on the underlying data, where supported
      <T> Optional<T> getUnderlyingPlatformDriver(Class<T> driver_class, Optional<String> driver_options)
      USE WITH CARE: this returns the driver to the underlying technology shouldn't be used unless absolutely necessary!

      Performs a simple lucene-type query on the underlying data, where supported

      Performs a simple lucene-type query on the underlying data, where supported

    • Method Detail

      • count

        CompletableFuture<Long> count(Optional<String> query_string,
                              Optional<String> filter_string)
        Count the number of objects matching a simple lucene-type query on the underlying data, where supported
        Parameters:
        query_string - - A lucene formatted query
        filter_string - - A lucene formatted filter (doesn't affect scoring-based sort order, is sometimes faster)
        Returns:
        a future containing the number of matching objects

      • search

        CompletableFuture<scala.Tuple2<Iterable<O>,Optional<Map<String,Collection<scala.Tuple2<String,Long>>>>>> search(Optional<String> query_string,
                                                                                                                Optional<String> filter_string,
                                                                                                                Optional<Integer> limit,
                                                                                                                Optional<scala.Tuple2<String,Integer>> orderBy,
                                                                                                                Optional<Integer> skip,
                                                                                                                Optional<Collection<String>> return_fields,
                                                                                                                Optional<Map<String,Long>> facet_fields)
        Performs a simple lucene-type query on the underlying data, where supported
        Parameters:
        query_string - - A lucene formatted query
        filter_string - - A lucene formatted filter (doesn't affect scoring-based sort order, is sometimes faster)
        limit - - Optional max number of objects to return (defaults to 100)
        order_by - - Optional ordering - first term in tuple is fieldname, second is <0 for ascending >0 for descending (if not specified then orders by score)
        skip - - Optional initial number of records to ignore
        return_fields - - list of fields to return
        facet_fields - - A map of field name (supports dot notation) vs max number of terms to bring back as facets
        Returns:
        a 2-tuple - the first is a collection of matching objects, the second is a map of fields to facet on (value is the long

      • search

        CompletableFuture<Iterable<O>> search(Optional<String> query_string,
                                      Optional<String> filter_string,
                                      Optional<Integer> limit,
                                      Optional<scala.Tuple2<String,Integer>> orderBy,
                                      Optional<Integer> skip,
                                      Optional<Collection<String>> return_fields)
        Performs a simple lucene-type query on the underlying data, where supported
        Parameters:
        query_string - - A lucene formatted query
        filter_string - - A lucene formatted filter (doesn't affect scoring-based sort order, is sometimes faster)
        limit - - Optional max number of objects to return (defaults to 100)
        order_by - - Optional ordering - first term in tuple is fieldname, second is <0 for ascending >0 for descending (if not specified then orders by score)
        skip - - Optional initial number of records to ignore
        return_fields - - list of fields to return
        Returns:
        a a collection of matching objects

      • search

        CompletableFuture<Iterable<O>> search(Optional<String> query_string,
                                      Optional<String> filter_string,
                                      Optional<Integer> limit)
        Performs a simple lucene-type query on the underlying data, where supported
        Parameters:
        query_string - - A lucene formatted query
        filter_string - - A lucene formatted filter (doesn't affect scoring-based sort order, is sometimes faster)
        limit - - Optional max number of objects to return (defaults to 100)
        Returns:
        a a collection of matching objects

      • getUnderlyingPlatformDriver

        <T> Optional<T> getUnderlyingPlatformDriver(Class<T> driver_class,
                                            Optional<String> driver_options)
        USE WITH CARE: this returns the driver to the underlying technology shouldn't be used unless absolutely necessary!
        Parameters:
        driver_class - the class of the driver
        a - string containing options in some technology-specific format
        Returns:
        a driver to the underlying technology. Will exception if you pick the wrong one!
